---------------------------------------------------------------------
No more than a dark pencil line on a blank page. A horizon line, 
maybe. But also a slot for blackness to pour through...

----

A terrible accident takes Edger Freemantle's right arm and 
scrambles his memory and his mind, leaving him little but rage as 
he begins the ordeal of rehabilitation. When his marriage suddenly 
ends, Edgar begins to wish he hadn't survived his injuries. He 
wants out. His psychologist suggests a new life distant from the 
Twin Cities, along with something else:

"Edgar, does anything make you happy?"
"I used to sketch."
"Take it up again. You need hedges...hedges against the night."

Edgar leaves for Duma Key, an eerily undeveloped splinter of the 
Florida coast. The sun setting into the Gulf of Mexico calls out to 
him, and Edgar draws. Once he meets Elizabeth Eastlake, a sick old 
woman with roots tangled deep in Duma Key, Edgar begins to paint, 
sometimes feverishly; many of his paintings have a power that 
cannot be controlled. When Elizabeth's past unfolds and the ghosts 
of her childhood begin to appear, the damage of which they are 
capable is truly devastating.

The tenacity of love, the perils of creativity, the mysteries of 
memory and the nature of the supernaturalÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½Stephen King gives us a 
novel as fascinating as it is gripping and terrifying.

----

Stephen King has written more than forty novels and two hundred 
short stories. He is the recipient of the 2003 National Book 
Foundation Medal for Distinguished Contributions to American 
Letters and the Canadian Booksellers Association Libris Award for 
Lifetime Achievement. In 2007 he was inducted as a Grand Master of 
the Mystery Writers of America. Among his most recent bestsellers 
are Lisey's Story, Cell, the Dark Tower series, On Writing, The 
Green Mile, and Bag of Bones. He lives in Bangor, Maine, with his 
wife, novelist Tabitha King.

----

John Slattery appears on film in Clint Eastwood's Flags of Our 
Fathers, Charlie Wilson's War, and Reservation Road. Other films 
include Mona Lisa Smile, Bad Company, Traffic, The Station Agent 
and Sleepers. His extensive TV work includes regular roles on the 
critical hit Mad Men, Desperate Housewives, K Street and memorable 
guest appearances on Sex and the City, and Will & Grace.

READ ME!: On CD 13 and CD 16 there were small damaged areas 
scratched from the tops of the discs. On each disc it was in nearly 
the same area, about 1.5 cm in from the outer edge. EAC did not 
give any errors but there may be some corruption as a result 
roughly 3/4 through on each of these discs. I hope it does not ruin 
the experience in any way.
